channel.title: Life on Eejain Huang
channel.description: Recent content in Life on Eejain Huang

item.title: A pond and a river
item.description: .org-center { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center; } I pondered a lot about the pale thin limbs of hers, of curves that blends into mine. I coil around her eyes possessed of a deepest black, soaked with the obsessive fixation on outcry. Yet her blood from screaming is asphalt grey. It’s greying, it’s the grass by the pond. I am in love with her sudden burst of emotion of unknown origin.

item.title: Planning 2020 Beyond Work-Life Balance
item.description: A Broken Self and a New Decade # With the tingly smell of mulled wine, the dazzling Christmas lights in Berlin streets, I found myself in a very dark place at the end of 2019: it’s the end of a decade yet my life is full of loose ends. Trying so hard to be the best version of myself as an instructor, a scholar, and a creator, I had, not literally, untied shoe laces that will trip myself over nothing every single day.
